documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: thunderbird security update

note.text:
An update for thunderbird is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Advanced Update Support, Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Telecommunications Update Service, and Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.2 Update Services for SAP Solutions.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
Mozilla Thunderbird is a standalone mail and newsgroup client.

This update upgrades Thunderbird to version 102.9.0.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Incorrect code generation during JIT compilation (CVE-2023-25751)

* Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 111 and Firefox ESR 102.9 (CVE-2023-28176)

* Mozilla: Potential out-of-bounds when accessing throttled streams (CVE-2023-25752)

* Mozilla: Invalid downcast in Worklets (CVE-2023-28162)

* Mozilla: URL being dragged from a removed cross-origin iframe into the same tab triggered navigation (CVE-2023-28164)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
note.title: Details

note.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue of invalidating JIT code while following an iterator. The newly generated code could be overwritten incorrectly, leading to a potentially exploitable crash.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2178458: CVE-2023-25751 Mozilla: Incorrect code generation during JIT compilation

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Lukas Bernhard as the original reporter.

note.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue that when accessing throttled streams, the count of available bytes needs to be checked in the calling function to be within bounds. This may have led future code to be incorrect and vulnerable.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2178460: CVE-2023-25752 Mozilla: Potential out-of-bounds when accessing throttled streams

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Ronald Crane as the original reporter.

note.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes the issue that while implementing AudioWorklets, some code may have cast one type to another, invalid, dynamic type. This could have led to a potentially exploitable crash.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2178466: CVE-2023-28162 Mozilla: Invalid downcast in Worklets

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Lukas Bernhard as the original reporter.

note.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory described the issue of dragging a URL from a cross-origin iframe that was removed during the drag could have led to user confusion and website spoofing attacks.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2178470: CVE-2023-28164 Mozilla: URL being dragged from a removed cross-origin iframe into the same tab triggered navigation

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Luan Herrera as the original reporter.

note.text: A flaw was found in Mozilla. The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory described the issue in which Mozilla developers Timothy Nikkel, Andrew McCreight, and the Mozilla Fuzzing Team reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 110 and ESR 102.8. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption, and we presume that with enough effort, some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

All running instances of Thunderbird must be restarted for the update to take effect.

reference.Description: bz#2178472: CVE-2023-28176 Mozilla: Memory safety bugs fixed in Firefox 111 and Firefox ESR 102.9

acknowledgment.Description: Red Hat would like to thank the Mozilla project for reporting this issue. Upstream acknowledges Mozilla developers and community as the original reporter.
